text: Hi all! I am new here and relatively new to HubSpot. Just started working with it in November and trying to get up to speed with HubL code and developing or editing custom modules and templates. I am NOT a web developer, but I'm the closest thing my company has to one!
Hi everyone! I have just started the HubSpot CMS for Developers.  Ready to learn some cool new stuff :nerd_face:

Hi everybody. I'm not a developers, I was asked to "build" a website and a couple of landing pages with HubSpot cms.
I'm quite stuck atm.. trying to understand how it works and to get things done.. anyone willing to help me figure out some basics please?
I would start off with HubSpot base files called VAST. They will be in the design manager.

I would look at the HubSpot Academy lessons about the CMS - both the one for developers and for marketers to get an idea of how to build templates and pages.
<https://app.HubSpot.com/academy/10734/tracks/34/289/1564>
<https://app.HubSpot.com/academy/10734/tracks/50/400/2145>

Thanks for your answer... but I found out that javascript programming is required in order to make the templates editable in the page editors.
I've no such skills... is there any "standard" js to include with basic features? such as background images for fullwidth group modules and so on?
<@UTTA3GB7U> you shouldn't need JS to make templates. You could start with some drag n drop templates using prebuilt modules.

that's what I'm trying to do.. but I have a website to build, that need different background images on same grouped modules (with different texts of course), saw on Vast templates that to edit those bg images in the page editor they added js...
